com.stylepoints.habittracker.repository

Class HabitRepository

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stylepoints.habittracker.repository.HabitRepository

  • public class HabitRepository
extends java.lang.Object
    A singleton class that acts as an abstraction layer between the user interface and either the local Habit storage, or the remote Habit storage. The data returned to the UI are instances of LiveData, which is basically an observable class that is also aware of android specific lifecycle information.

      • save

        public void save(Habit habit)
          throws NonUniqueException
        Create a new Habit and save it both locally and remotely.
        Parameters:
        habit - The habit we wish to add to local and remote storage
        Throws:
        NonUniqueException - when a Habit with that `type` already exists

      • update

        public void update(java.lang.String id,
                   Habit habit)
        Update the Habit with id to what is passed in in habit. Changes propagate locally and remotely.
        Parameters:
        id - unique habit id used to specify which habit we are updating
        habit - What the old habit should be updated to
